intro: Psychotria ernestii, commonly known as the Ernest's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale green flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when ripe. Psychotria ernestii is often found in humid, shaded environments such as montane forests.
